alert.note: Alert for Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:17PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A pair of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Big Horn and north central Sheridan Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 515 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a pair of strong thunderstorms over south central Big Horn county, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wyola and Tongue River Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If you are on Tongue River Reservoir get off the lake and seek shelter now. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Billings.
